Posts.Content: I have been on tamoxifen for over a year.  I have had some hair thinning, but not much.  another friend is also on it and had very, very thin hair before her chemo and hers has remained thin.  I would not be too concerned about going on it.  You will not be bald.   Jenny
Posts.Title: question about a medicine..

Posts.Content: I started treatment with the anti-cancer drugs in October 2003. I first tried Arimedex and had such pain I could hardly stand it. I was switched to Femora and still problems. So I am now on Aromasin and still have trouble walking. The pain is often deep inside and then seems to "cramp" up certain muscles. My chriropractor works wonders, but I need to go weekly to be able to walk somewhat normal. When I sit for long periods, like driving or flying, I have to stand for a minute before trying to walk because I feel like an old woman. I wonder if it could be exasperated by arthritis, but I never had problems before going on these drugs. Anyone else experiencing such trouble walking? Jennys
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Aromasin

Posts.Content: I have tried all three of the newer drugs in the last 3 years - arimidex, femora and aromasin.  I am now on tamoxifen and have no real side effects and am actually working out again and feel human.  The other three drugs all caused various leg and hip problems.  I walked like a little old lady and was in constant, constant pain.  The last drug, aromisen caused my achilles heels to both become so severely inflamed that I spent 4 months in physical therapy to undo the damage.  I have also been living at my chiropractor's since starting all treatment.  But I do know some people who have had no side effects on these drugs, but mine were incapacitating.  Jenny
Posts.Title: arimidex~side effects

Posts.Content: I was on Armidex, Femara and Aromisen.  All three incapacitated me to the point where even walking was painful.  The worst effect was on Aromisen when I developed horrible inflamed tendons in both my ankles.  My physical therapist said she was amazed I had not popped both of them.  I switched to tamoxifan about 9 mos ago and have had no problems except some hot flashes.  I am on efexxor for that and the lowest dose stopped them literally overnight.  My oncologist also said that there have been reports on all three of the other drugs of problems with carpal tunnel as well.  Jenny
Posts.Title: arimedex

Posts.Content: Hi.  I was on armidex first after I finished my cancer treatment in 2003.  But I could not tolerate the side effects.  For me, it was all stiffness in the hips and legs to the point of not being able to walk very far without unbelievable pain.  I also tried femora and aromasin with similar problems.  Have been on tamaxifen for over a year and can tolerate this one fine.  Good luck.  Jenny
Posts.Title: Arimides

Posts.Content: I was on armidex, femara, aromisen and had such bad side effects I could barely walk for 3 years.  The final straw was when both my achilles tendons became so tight that I had to spend 3 mos of physical therapy to get over that (still some damage too).  So my oncologist put me on tamoxifen.  I too was so scared of unterine cancer that my gyn and I decided to be very proactive about it.  So, once a year when I go for my pap test etc, she also does a unterine biopsy.  It is painful so she has me take a vicodin and a valuium 30 minutes before my appt (and I am pleasantly in another zone (have someone else drive you to appt).  I have done this for two years now and feel I am watching out for everything.  Other than hot flashes, no other problems with tamoxifen.  My gyn also said that if I was still worried about uterine cancer, she would remove the uterus.  Good luck.  Jenny
Posts.Title: estrogen inhibitors

Posts.Content: I was on armidex, femara, aromisen and had such bad side effects I could barely walk for 3 years.  The final straw was when both my achilles tendons became so tight that I had to spend 3 mos of physical therapy to get over that (still some damage too).  So my oncologist put me on tamoxifen.  I too was so scared of unterine cancer that my gyn and I decided to be very proactive about it.  So, once a year when I go for my pap test etc, she also does a unterine biopsy.  It is painful so she has me take a vicodin and a valuium 30 minutes before my appt (and I am pleasantly in another zone (have someone else drive you to appt).  I have done this for two years now and feel I am watching out for everything.  Other than hot flashes, no other problems with tamoxifen.  My gyn also said that if I was still worried about uterine cancer, she would remove the uterus.  Good luck.  Jenny
Posts.Title: estrogen inhibitors

Posts.Content: Yes, I am on both and have terrible leg pain, particularly in the hip area. I talked to my oncologist this week and he is taking me off both for one month to see which one is causing the problems. I will let you know what is happening. Jennys
Posts.Title: Aromasin/joint Pain

Posts.Content: Hi, my name is Jenny.  I was diagnosed with breast cancer in March 2003.  I was have tried all three armitase inhibitors and like you I too could not tolerate the pain.  My chiropractor was able to give me a lot of relief and helped keep my sanity.  However, my oncologist finally switched me to tamoxifen and I have virtually no side effects and no pain.  Hot flashes are about all.  Ask about switching to tamoxifen.  Good luck.  I care.
Posts.Title: Aromitase Inhibitors

Posts.Content: I had a lumpectomy in 2003, but I did have chemo and radiation.  My oncologist put me on all three aromatose inhibitors (femora, armoasin and arimidex).  With all three the joint pain and lower body pain was so extreme I could not tolerate them.  So he switched me to tamoxifen about 3 years ago and I have tolerated that quite well.  You should ask the oncologist point blank why she needs to take the meds now.  and then I would ask about tamoxifen, which is the oldest and most researched of all the meds out there.  Other than hot flashes I am able to tolerate with few side effects, unlike the other three drugs.    Good luck.  Jenny
Posts.Title: Questions about Aromasin

Posts.Content: I have been on tamoxifen for 1-1/2 years.  I had always had low blood pressure, and since taking this, mine is more elevated.  Not sure it is entirely due to the meds, but what else?  Hot flashes continue to be a problem and unfortunately, weight gain.  But I could not tolerate the other new drugs, so this is it.  Jenny
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen side effects

Posts.Content: Hi - I was on femara, aromisen and arimidex and could not tolerate any of them.  Had such several leg and hip pain I could barely walk.  Evenutally had major achilles tendon problems and spent 3 mos in physical therapy.  So my onologist switched me to tamoxifen and other than hot flashes, I am doing very well with this drug.  Good luck.  Jenny
Posts.Title: side effects from Femara

Posts.Content: I was on Femara, Aromisen and Arimidex.  All three caused horrible leg, hip and tendon pain in my ankles.  it got so bad I could barely walk and felt and acted like an old, old woman.  I am on Tamoxifen (over a year now) and have had no side effects, except bad hot flashes.  I am taking a mild anti-depressant called effexor for that and it stopped them literaly overnight.  Good luck.  Jenny
Posts.Title: Femara Side Effects

Posts.Content: I too am taking tamoxifen (after trying all three aromitase inhibators and unable to tolerate any of them).  I too felt "out of it", but at the time, I was also on effexor for hot flashes.  My oncologist said it could be my thyroid and checked it via boodwork - all okay.  Went off the effexor and feel much better.   Jenny
Posts.Title: Tamoxifin/Thyroid

Posts.Content: I too tried Aromasin, Femora and Armidex.  Horrible, horrible side effects.  After 2-1/2 years trying all of them, my oncologist switched me to tamoxafin.  The only side effect I really have is hot flashes, a small price to pay.  Please discuss this with your oncologist.  Jenny
Posts.Title: Aromasin Treatment

Posts.Content: I was on Aromisan for over a year and got such badly inflamed achilles tendons in both feet that i had to go off the drugs. Spent 4 mos in physical therapy to undo the damage. Still some problems, but much, much better. Am on tamoxifen now and no major side effects except hot flashes and some depression. Jenny
Posts.Title: Does Anyone Get Painful Ankles and Feel While on Aromasin?

Posts.Content: I was on Aromisan for over a year and got such badly inflamed achilles tendons in both feet that i had to go off the drugs. Spent 4 mos in physical therapy to undo the damage. Still some problems, but much, much better. Am on tamoxifen now and no major side effects except hot flashes and some depression. Jenny
Posts.Title: Does Anyone Get Painful Ankles and Feel While on Aromasin?

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with breast cancer in 2003.  I had estrogen postive stage 2.  I went through chemo and radiation and tried all of the aromitose inhibators, including arimidex.  I could not tolerate any of them so my doctor put my on tamoxifen.  Except for hot flashes, I have tolerated this drug very, very well.  I had horrible side effects on the others.  As your oncologist about tamoxifen instead.  And you are not alone.  Many, many other women I know cannot tolerate arimidex, aromisen or femora.  Hope this helps.   Jenny
Posts.Title: Armimidex and side effects
